title: Police investigate double shooting in Northwest Jacksonville that leaves 1 dead, 1 wounded
content:
One person was killed and another critically wounded in shootings of several people in Northwest Jacksonville’s Edgewood Manor area about 7:30 p.m. Wednesday evening, police said.
Police called to the 2300 block of Lantana Avenue said Jacksonville Fire Rescue took two victims to UF Health where one died and the second was treated for life-threatening wounds. Investigators did not say how many were shot but that there were several vehicles in the area though it is not clear if they were related to the shooting.
The shooting occurred about a half mile from Raines High School.
Times-Union news partner First Coast News said the victims were male.
Anyone who has any information about the shooting can contact the Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office at (904) 630-0500 or email JSOCrimeTips@jaxsheriff.org. To remain anonymous contact Crime Stoppers at (866) 845-TIPS.
